Boston.com
10

Thousands mourn fallen New Hampshire police chief

A service for Greenland Chief Michael Maloney began at noon in Hampton. Maloney was fatally shot last week executing a search warrant for drugs. (Globe, 1:33 p.m.)
  • Pictures Scenes from the funeral  |  Video

BC trustee who supervised priest in sex abuse case steps down from board

Rev. Bradley M. Schaeffer stepped down after criticism of his role in supervising a former Jesuit priest who allegedly molested dozens of children. (Globe, 2:09 p.m.)
  • Schaeffer failed oversight of a predator priest
Pictures

Single-family homes in Mass. for $350K

What can you get for $350,000? There's a variety of homes with varying plots, from a move-in ready house in Leominster to a fixer-upper in Watertown.
  • Pictures N.E. mansions for $10m | Search for homes

New head of UMass Dartmouth chosen

Divina Grossman, a vice president at Florida International University, will take over from Jean MacCormack after the school year ends. (Globe, 2:54 p.m.)

Massachusetts jobless rate at 6.5%

The state added 8,700 jobs in March as the unemployment rate fell to 6.5 percent, down from 6.9 percent in February, the state said. (Globe, 2:15 p.m.)
  • US unemployment claims signal slower hiring
Globe-trotting

Kerfuffle over 'Fugging' name

The mayor of an Austrian town whose name sounds like Foo-king but is spelled like a curse word is disputing claims the town may vote to change its name. (Globe)

BU: Student killed in Allston shooting

A graduate student at Boston University was killed early today in an apparent shooting in Allston, the university said today. No arrest has been made. (Globe, 2:09 p.m.)

2012, how I miss thee

US Senator Scott Brown and Mitt Romney, the presumptive GOP presidential nominee, have taken half the population for a ride in the way-back machine.
Opinion | Joshua Green

Clemens is a useful idiot

Steroid use among teenagers has plummeted, thanks in part to prosecution of athletes, including former pitcher Roger Clemens, who went on trial this week.

Broadcasters watch ruling on ads

Public radio and television stations are weighing risks of accepting political advertising after a federal court found an existing ban on such ads unconstitutional.
Book review

'Garbology'

We are a wasteful society with a trash problem that is polluting our oceans and packing our landfills.

Senate campaigns for the dogs

Senator Scott Brown made his allegiance to man’s best friend known in a new campaign blog, a press release, and a video that shows him nuzzling against his two dogs.

Climate shift could help struggling N.E. species

A number of struggling species are set to benefit from the early spring, which can result in a greater food supply for local herbivores.

Bringing women, whiskey together

Peggy Noe Stevens plans to launch a Boston chapter of Bourbon Women, which aims to cultivate savvy female bourbon drinkers and dismantle stereotypes.

Health & Wellness

CDC: 2011 was worst measles
year in US in 15 years

There were 222 cases of measles reported. Most of the cases were imported -- either by visiting foreigners or by US residents who picked up the virus overseas.
